Front Porch is a nonprofit provider of housing and services. We create community. Itâ€™s at the heart of all we do. As a not-for-profit family of communities and partnerships, weâ€™re united in this commitment and dedicated to meeting the needs of the people and places we serve.

Â Social Call (SC) is a friendly visiting program of Front Porch Community Services. SC provides people 60 years and older the opportunity to form social connections through weekly visits with a volunteer via phone or video. A SC program manager is responsible for leading the day-to-day activities of SC. This position is part of a small team, working closely with other managers and the SC Director within the Community Services division.Â Â English and Spanish fluency, written, verbal, and interpersonal are required.Â Â 

*This position is primarily remote work, candidate must be in California, with in-person meetings in the SF Bay Area up to 2-4x/year.Â  Must have the ability to work occasional weekends and evenings.

Responsibilities include:

  • Use creative outreach approaches, both digital and in-person, to increase program participation, with a special emphasis on Spanish-speaking older people
  • Manage a portfolio of participants and volunteers, including onboarding, matching, and supervising
  • Develop, maintain and support connections within the Social Call community
  • Support older participant needs, including referrals to appropriate resources
  • Conduct regular volunteer trainings and support opportunities
  • Keep accurate and timely documentation
  • Attend regular team and supervision meetings
  • Track & report data
  • Develop and maintain partnerships to support program developmentÂ 
  • Maintain knowledge of loneliness & social connection information that impact population served
  • Daily administrative duties related to work
  • Other duties as assigned

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:

Our organizational values: Connect, Build Trust, Collaborate, Lead Responsibly, Inspire Creativity, Embrace Change

Connect

  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills

Build Trust

  • Strong commitment to diversity and ability to make program decisions through an equity lens

Collaborate

  • Talent for forming and strengthening robust community relationships to meet specific programmatic objectives
  • Emphasize working collaboratively with othersÂ 

Lead Responsibly

  • Ability to play a leadership role in program development and growth
  • Self-motivated, curious, goal-oriented, and caring individual that works well independently, while also being able to work effectively and collaboratively within a team and with community partners

Inspire Creativity

  • Must be creative and an innovative thinker with entrepreneurial drive to grow program impact

Embrace Change

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills in an environment with competing priorities
  • High degree of digital literacy: ability to adapt to new digital tools
  • Assist with occasional special events
  • Other duties as assigned

Education & qualifications:

  • English and Spanish fluency, written, verbal, and interpersonal
  • 4+ years of professional or educational experience

Casa De Manana

Bonus Eligible $1,000

~ If youâ€™ve got a big heart, we want to talk to you ~

Title: Dishwasher - Full Time
Full-Time: Wednesday - Sunday
Off days: Monday and Tuesday
Hours: 11:30am â€“ 8:00pm
Pay: $18.00/hr - $19.00/hr
Benefits and Paid Time Off: Yes

***Note: Senior care facilities like ours take greater steps to ensure safety for the residents at our community. We will require all applicants to pass a comprehensive criminal background check and drug test (marijuana testing included), along with testing physical ability and TB. ***

Casa de MaÃ±ana Retirement Community is all about heart. We love people who care, and we care for the people you love. Come see why the vibe at our community is unlike any place youâ€™ve ever worked at.

What separates us from working at a restaurant? Every customer is a regular. Get to know their stories and share their wisdom. If you made someone feel special on a Monday, youâ€™ll hear about it on Tuesday. Weâ€™re sure you have great plans for your future, and this is the perfect position to use a stepping stone to get exposed to working in a kitchen, being around cooks, and launching a career in the culinary arts.

WHO WE WANT
We are looking for a Dishwasher who is passionate about providing quality customer service to our residents. The ideal candidate should be punctual, have good personal hygiene, and is always readily available to jump in to help with cleaning or other kitchen duties.

WHO YOU ARE
You have a positive mindset and possess a knack for making other people smile. Youâ€™re adaptable, open to change, and collaborate well with others. You value human connections and take extra steps to build trust with people. You believe that everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect, and display good patience for those who need more encouragement.

WHAT THE ENVIRONMENT IS LIKE
You will see the Pacific Ocean every day you drive into work. You can have lunch on a bench close to the beach. You may notice our residents warmly greeting you as they go about their day. In the kitchen however, you will be regularly exposed to water, humidity, and be expected to work with your hands to scrub down pots and pans.

During work, you be will frequently be required to stand, walk, examine things, and clearly communicate. You must also be able to:

Regularly: lift and/or move up to 40 pounds, exposed to wet and/or humid conditions and moving mechanical parts, exposed to loud noise levels

Occasionally: lift and/or move above 40 pounds with the assistance from a co-worker and/or mechanical means. Exposed to fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; extreme cold, extreme heat, risk of electrical shock and vibration

Note that the work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

JobPostingExport.Description: Program Coordinator - Home Match - San Rafael
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
Downtown San Rafael, CAÂ 

The Home Match Program Coordinator - is responsible for fielding all inbound inquiries â€“ phone, email and online â€“ from prospective program participants from across all Home Match programs in order to meet and advance Home Matchâ€™s mission and goals. Participants inquire about the program via phone calls, emails and written messages on online housing boards. This role is critical as it is the first point of contact potential applicants have with the organization and communications should be delivered in a welcoming and professional manner.Â 

Home Match helps communities meet three important goals: empowering aging community members to stay in their chosen homes; creating affordable places to live; and combating social isolation. We create affordable housing options for our local workforce, retirees and students while simultaneously preventing the displacement and/or homelessness of the elders in our community. Both groups benefit from a sense of community in the home. Fluency in Spanish or Chinese highly desired. Non exempt position; minimal evenings and weekend work, events as needed.

Office position in downtown San Rafael, CA.Â Â Apply today and we'd like to meet you!

Responsibilities

  • Answer phones, email and online inquiries and provide excellent customer service support
  • Provide information and referral to clients
  • Email communication with participants and partner agencies
  • Data input, tracking, reporting
  • Perform general office duties
  • In-person support with intakes and home visits as needed in four Bay Area counties
  • Other functions as assigned

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Self-motivated, organized, detail oriented and able to work independently with little guidance
  • Bilingual in English, and Spanish or Chinese (Cantonese and/or Mandarin) highly desirable
  • Experience in a customer service, sales or fundraising
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Experience in housing and/or older adult services
  • Computer skills: Microsoft Office, social media platforms and a general comfort with online databases and systems
  • Must have cultural awareness and a strong desire to work with a very diverse set of individuals including older adults.
  • Experience and comfort working in a highly collaborative team setting
  • Minimal work during evenings and weekends, and events as needed.

Education and Qualifications

  • Minimum two-years professional experience
  • Minimum two-year degree or equivalent experience
  • CA Drivers License required - driving to various sites is required

This is a non-exempt position. Hourly pay range: $28.84 - 31.25

Summary:

The Server I is responsible for serving residents and guests in the main dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and in the personal care dining room. Serves residents in private parties, setting up and serving catered parties, cleaning up the dining room, and any other meal service rooms as needed. Assigns proper charges to residents for guest meals, wine served, or any other miscellaneous charges not included in the monthly fees. It is required that this position be in full compliance with HIPAA.

Responsibilities:

  • Serves food and beverages to residents and guests in the dining room, in the personal care dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and other areas where food is served.
  • Provides professional and courteous service using correct service techniques.
  • Takes resident and guest food orders and carries food to table using waiter trays.
  • Sets up and serves catered parties and coffee breaks as assigned. Breaks down and cleans up after catered parties.
  • Serves residents and their guests in the Dining Room, and is responsible for properly charging each account for food and beverages served.
  • Sets up, serves and takes down all breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets.
  • Considers placement of foods to create an attractive display that is convenient for residents.
  • Maintains the cleanliness of the areas, and assures dish ware and/or utensils are supplied as needed.
  • Performs side duties as assigned, including preparing the dining room for service and maintaining the cleanliness of the dining room, the wait stations, tea room, and private rooms after catered events, and related kitchen areas.
  • Attends and participates in menu meetings and monthly in-service meetings as scheduled.
  • Employee must be able to work well under pressure; meeting multiple and sometimes competing deadlines. Employee must at all times demonstrate cooperative behavior with staff, colleagues, and supervisors.
  • Assists Host/Hostess with opening duties as assigned.
  • Answers phone calls in the dining room in the absence of the Host/Hostess, using proper language as instructed.
  • Takes messages and forwards to the appropriate people.
  • Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; and if an emergency or disaster occurs, immediately assumes the pre-assigned emergency duties.
  • Performs other duties or responsibilities as assigned by the Assistant Director of Dining Services, Executive Chef and the Director of Dinning Services.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • English proficiency.
  • Experience or aptitude for working with senior citizens preferred.
  • Must be customer-oriented and possess good communication skills.
  • Able to follow both written and verbal instructions and relate to older people.
  • Able to manage several tasks at one time efficiently and temperately.
  • Able to form cooperative, effective, productive working relationships.
  • Able to learn new tasks as the department grows and develops.

Must be Korean speaking.

SUMMARY

Under supervision of the Executive Assistant, assists with coordinating general operations of the corporate office.

Must be Korean speaking.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Provides administrative support to Burbank staff, including typing, photocopying, binding, and packaging and mailing items. Assists with travel preparation as needed. Reviews invoices for accuracy and processes for payment.

Supervises reception support and provides reception support on a weekly basis, including sending reminders, and resolving problems as needed to assure all tasks are completed.

Coordinates kitchen duty assignments and follow through including sending reminders and resolving problems as needed to assure all tasks are completed.

Purchases and maintains office supplies, office stationary, and office equipment. For example, purchasing fax machines, shredders etc. Maintains office copiers, postage machines and folding inserting systems including scheduling services, filling paper trays etc.

Coordinate internal office moves including cubicle reconfiguration.

Manages, tracks and maintains shared office space and conference rooms including stocking areas regularly, maintaining updated company rosters, and repairing of furniture as needed.

Keeps mailroom and workspaces clean, neat and fully stocked. Maintains office appearance including but not limited to scheduling carpet cleaning, painting and other office renovations.

Responsible of maintaining and tracking office keys including ordering, issuing and replacing office keys.

Acts as transportation coordinator for the Burbank office, including monitoring vehicle license, registration, and fuel card expenses. Responsible for maintaining and tracking company vehicle including but not limited to having the vehicle serviced, and cleaned.

Assists with scheduling catering for meetings held at the Burbank Office, including set up and cleans up of the area. Coordinates and supervise events and meetings including interfacing with outside vendors (establishing and maintaining good relationships), negotiating rates, site determination, coordinating transportation, event preparation, set up and follow through. Tracks program and event expenses.

QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Â 

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of office operations, including inter-facility (pouch) mail, US postal service and other courier services, recycle program, etc.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; sit; and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

SUMMARY: Under the direction of the Executive Director / Administrator, plans, organizes, develops and evaluates the overall operation of the Nursing Services Department in accordance with current State and Federal regulations. Maintains current standards of nursing practices. Implements facility policies, procedures and management systems. Coordinates nursing services with community agencies, physicians, families, residents, consultants, ancillary service providers and other department personnel within the facility. Promotes quality care delivery by all providers.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.

Recruits, hires, schedules, supervises, counsels, evaluates all nursing service employees according to established policies and procedures.

Ensures 24-hour provision of nursing services within Federal, State, and company requirements based on acuity of residents.

Supervises the health care services and programs to residents.

Coordinates resident admissions, transfers and discharges with other departments with community agencies.

Directs and supervises utilization of Medicare, Medi-Cal and Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) contracts.

Supervises and participates in resident interdisciplinary care plan conferences. Supervises documentation in resident health records and reviews scheduled audits.

Participates in budget planning and monitoring of fee scheduling and charging for services and cost-effectiveÂ utilization of resources.

Responsible for orientation and on-going in-service education of all nursing staff.

Provides professional management to State and Federal survey process following up with writing and implementing plan/s of correction.

Works closely with the Director of Quality Assurance and consultants to provide geriatric health programs and services.

Promotes stimulation, comfortable, uplifting environments for residents, families and staff.

Develops and revises Nursing Policy and Procedure Manuals as needed.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: Current licensure by the California Board of Registered Nursing. Experience in long-term care community health, geriatric and/or rehabilitative nursing desirable. Three years supervisory experience required. Knowledgeable in current State and Federal regulation.

LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read, analyze and interpret professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations. Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS: Basic mathematical skills required.

REASONING ABILITY: Must be able to understand, follow, support and initiate policies and procedures of the facility. Must be able to recognize emergency situations and respond appropriately. Must be able to plan, organize, prioritize and implement work assignments efficiently. Must be able to function effectively with no supervision.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Moderate: standing, walking, talking, listening, grasping, reaching, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, smelling, pushing and pulling. Must be able to wear gloves to guard against exposure to body fluids and cleaning agents.

Under the direction of the Director of Resident Services/Charge Nurse or designee, the Caregiver is responsible for performing routine nursing assistant services to the residents of the facility. Provides resident care according to policies and procedures and within acceptable nursing standards.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS FOR A CAREGIVER / DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

  • Assists residents with bathing, dressing and personal hygiene.
  • Washes residentâ€™s personal laundry as needed. Makes residentâ€™s beds daily.
  • Maintains a safe and sanitary environment.
  • Maintains log with all vital information.
  • Reports to Supervisor regularly regarding the resident's condition.
  • Maintains all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations and Company policy.

BENEFITS INCLUDE:
- competitive wages,
- amazing health benefits (medical, dental & vision for 32+ hrs per week)
- employer paid life insurance,
- a great retirement program,
- holiday pay,
- paid time off (or sick time),
- free employee meals,
- monthly team meetings and celebrations,
- use of the fitness facilities.

On-Call, Any Day, 6:00am - 2:30pm, 2pm - 10:30pm, or 10 pm-7:30 am
Full-Time

    Summary: Shift RN

    The Staff Registered Nurse (RN) functions independently in performing nursing care through assessment, planning, intervention and evaluation of safe therapeutic care for patientsâ€™ overt and covert needs and/or complications of treatment during his or her assigned shift. Also leads and directs ancillary members of the health care team.

    Responsibilities:

    Â·Completes appropriate written history/assessment on residentsâ€™ clinical record within 4 hours of admission, including details from interviews with family, responsible parties and other nurses and physicians.

    Â·Legibly documents symptoms that indicate risk on the clinical record; incorporates nursing diagnostic data into written assessments.

    Â·Documents information from family, other nurses and physicians in the written assessment.

    Â·Prepares documents reflecting knowledge of expectations included in the Minimum Data Set (MDS); contributes in an appropriate and timely manner to the MDS.

    Â·Documents identified problems; develops and contributes to the care plan using nursing diagnosis; adds resident teaching needs and discharge planning to clinical records.

    Â·Uses resources and involves resident and/or family when formulating a written plan of care.

    Â·Incorporates the medical plan into the interdisciplinary plan for care.

    Â·Updates the Kardex and care plans using nursing diagnosis and outcome criteria.

    Â·Follows time frames when carrying out medical/nursing plan of care.

    Â·Communicates changes and responses to care in shift report.

    Â·Documents and sets priorities for care of residents based on need and resident preference.

    Â·Safely performs and documents nursing interventions required by the resident assignment and consistent with scientific principles and facility policy.

    Â·Carries out and documents medical and nursing care plans for residents; coordinates resident care activities with other members of the healthcare team.

    Â·Responds to information or data indicating acute risk to resident; initiates and documents action to reduce or correct the risk.

    Â·Explains tests, procedures and disease progression to resident and/or family. Instructing and informs resident or family of skills essential to understand and cope with illness and to promote optimal health or, if indicated, the discharge process; assesses and records family level of understanding on the clinical record.

    Â·Ensures that resident is reassessed as status requires. Documents resident response to care in clinical record.

    Â·Regularly evaluates effectiveness of nursing intervention per the intended goals; revises care plans accordingly.

    Â·Participates in resident care conferences.

    Â·Provides formal and informal teaching activities to promote staff education and knowledge.

    Â·Communicates identified learning needs of others to resources able to meet learnersâ€™ needs.

    Â·Assists in orientation of new staff; shares knowledge, experiences and acts as a preceptor or mentor. Assists others in choosing nursing intervention, developing skills and applying knowledge.

    Â·Assists in employee performance evaluation as needed.

    Â·Is knowledgeable of, follows and directs others to follow facility policies and department procedures and nursing unit protocols.

    Â·Administers medications safely and accurately, following existing department procedures.

    Â·Follows infection control policies, procedures and standard precautions.

    Â·Recognizes and communicates to proper authority any ethical and legal issues relative to patient care.

    Â·Completes notification forms according to protocol and notifies appropriate personnel.

    Â·Models prevention and safety principles for residents and staff. Uses mechanical equipment correctly and appropriately per the procedure manual. Detects faulty equipment and notifies appropriate person for repairs.

    Â·Supervises delegated care based on patient acuity and abilities or limitations of health care personnel.

    Â·Notes changing resident status that affects nursing unit staffing needs and adjusts assignments accordingly.

    Â·Responds cooperatively to immediate staffing and/or resident care needs; assists other staff when necessary and available.

    Â·Utilizes the steps of problems solving to resolve identified resident related problems. Acts as a staff resource to in problem identification and resolution.

    Â·Reports unit related problems using the supervisory communications structure.

    Â·Listens to and respects the ideas, opinions and feelings of others.

    Â·Completes clinical assignment in a timely fashion including maintenance of equipment and supplies necessary for the provision of resident care through the next shift.

    Â·Completes non-clinical assignments, tasks and projects within a pre-established agreed upon time frame.

    Â·Prioritizes own workload relative to resident care needs.

    Â·Participates in staff meetings; obtains information presented in staff meetings when unable to attend.

    Â·Participates in nursing unit goal-setting.

    Â·Attends all mandatory in-service programs and performs committee work as requested.

    Â·Performs other duties within capabilities as assigned by Supervisor.

    Â·Participates in setting measurable, individual professional goals; acquires knowledge and experience to meet goals; achieves change and growth based on evaluation and feedback

    Â·Treats all guests, resident contacts, employees and staff with respect and courtesy. Receives, places and transfers calls using appropriate telephone etiquette.

    Â·Handles information requests with courtesy, accuracy and respect for confidentiality.

    Â·Respects attendance, time-off and sick call policies. Arrives to work on time and prepared to start assignment.

    Â·Understands department and facility policies and procedures, as well as safety and security policies and performs to those standards.

    Â·Completes mandatory safety and security education.

    Â·Maintains Universal Precautions (Standard Precautions).

    Â·Attends annual fire/safety and hazardous materials review.

    Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

    Â·Understanding of and compliance with HIPAA standards of practice and the California Nurse Practice Act.

    Â·Utilize an Electronic Health Records system like Point Click Care (PCC)

    Â·Able to work patients from ages 55 to 120.

    Â·Able to work well with others and to perform a variety of assigned duties.

    Education and Other Qualifications:

    Â·Current license to practice as a Registered Nurse in the state of California.

    Â·One year of experience in either acute care or long-term care preferred.

    Â·Current CPR certification.

    Â·Must complete and pass a physical examination with tuberculosis (TB) screen prior to employment.

Villa Gardens

JOB SUMMARY

Under the direction of the Director of Nursing the Infection Control Preventionist assumes the responsibility for the Infection Control Program of the facility. The position involves responsibilities in areas of case findings, surveillance, reporting, analysis, interpretation, inspection, control measures, education, consultation, evaluation and recommendations.Â Collaborates with all levels of nursing personnel as well as with facility consultants, physicians and department managers and other department employees in assessing needs for infection control prevention, control, implementation and management. Provides infection control program related education.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.
  • Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.
  • Arrives to work on time, in proper clean uniform, good personal hygiene and with nametag visible.
  • The Infection Preventionist performs daily activities and duties in the processes of infection prevention and control.
  • Performs surveillance to identify individual infections in residents, surveillance to identify individual infections in staff and to identify clusters of infection in a timely manner. Performs surveillance of antibiotic use, suspected infections, culture reports, pertinent lab data and post antibiotic use.
  • Works with each department manager to oversee and coordinate process and outcome of surveillance. Recognizes and manages an infection outbreak within the center
  • Tracks trends in infection within the center, reports specific infections, clusters and communicable diseases to appropriate agencies.
  • Reviews medical record documentation for infection identification, antibiotic use and appropriate transmission based precaution implementation. Documents the reason and need for specific transmission based precautions, if used.
  • Executes walking rounds assessing segments of the resident population at risk for infection and monitoring the use of transmission based precautions for specific residents.
  • Identifies infection prevention and control concerns through environmental rounds making recommendations for corrective actions. Monitors the availability of personal protective equipment (PPE) supplies. Monitors the availability of resident individualized care items.
  • Monitors and enforces infection prevention and control practices including employee compliance. Reviews outbreak preparedness within the center and educates each department in outbreak preparedness.
  • Oversees the process ensuring employees with communicable diseases are not caring for residents or working in food handling areas.
  • Coordinates the oversight of dietary personnel, the process ensuring staff with open skin lesions are not directly caring for residents or working in food handling areas unless the lesion can be covered/contained.
  • Provides new employee orientation related to infection prevention and control practices. Provides continuing education to center staff related to infection prevention and control. Functions as a resource to staff related to infection prevention and control practices. Provides infection prevention and control mentoring to all departments.
  • Attends community based, best practice based, continuing education based infection control programs.
  • Directs development and oversight of the centerâ€™s encompassing infection prevention and control program and develop a process to identify and manage residents, staff, visitors, volunteers and practitioners with infections.
  • Oversees the Tuberculosis (TB) and Bloodborne pathogen prevention program as well as oversees the exposure control plan. Oversees the immunization program for residents and healthcare workers.
  • Prepares for and chairs the infection prevention and control committee through the Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement (QAPI) committee review, revises, approves and maintains infection prevention and control policy and procedures
  • Any other duties assigned by the Director of Nursing associated with infection control and education of staff.
  • Maintains all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations and Company policy.
  • Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Uses equipment correctly and safely in performing patient/resident care. Follows department safety protocols at all times. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.
  • Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.
  • Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.

JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

  • Current state licensure (either a registered nurse or licensed vocational nurse)
  • Completed nursing program or equivalent required.
  • Advanced educational preparation in infection control.
  • Preferably a minimum of one year in infection control practice.
  • Progressive nursing experience with demonstrated leadership and teaching abilities.
  • Demonstrated skill in management principles of planning, organizing, and directing.
  • Strong communication skills, both oral and written. Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English.
  • Knowledge and awareness of the care needs of the elderly and/or chronically ill.
  • Knowledge and ability to teach adult learners.
  • Basic computer skills.
  • Must be able to organize, analyze, investigate and implement principles of infection control committee.
  • Experience in long-term care community health, geriatric and/or rehabilitative nursing desirable. Knowledgeable in current State and Federal regulation.
  • Basic mathematical skills required.
  • Must be able to understand, follow, support and initiate policies and procedures of the facility. Must be able to recognize emergency situations and respond appropriately.

Maintenance Assistant - Affordable HousingÂ 

JOB SUMMARY:Â 

Keeps the facility in clean and orderly condition by performing the following duties. Additionally assists with maintenance tasks as assigned.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES including the following. Other duties may also be assigned:

Assists the maintenance workers with work orders as requested or assigned by supervisor; including light maintenance functions included in the renovation of resident living units.

Sweeps, mops, scrubs and vacuums hallways, stairs, common areas, empty units, elevators and office space, etc...

Waxes and buffs floors / shampoos carpet

Cleans laundry room(s) and public restroom(s)

Empties trash and garbage containers and sanitizes garbage rooms and shoots.

Notifies management concerning need for repairs or replacements of lighting, heating and ventilating equipment.

Walks grounds and pick up debris and litter. Empties ashtrays, sweeps/blows sidewalks, and assists in the maintenance of the landscape and grounds.

Assists with scheduled inspections of apartments required by regulatory agencies.

Assists with the scheduling of the preventative cleaning schedule.

Assist with special events by setting up tables and chairs, moving equipment and boxes, etc.

Assists the maintenance workers with work orders as requested or assigned by supervisor; including light maintenance functions included in the renovation of units.

QUALIFICATION REQUIRMENTS:Â 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may e made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: High school education preferred but not required; or up to six months related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

LANGUAGE SKILLS:

Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:Â 

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers of common fractions and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

REASONING ABILITY:Â 

Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out detailed buy uninvolved written or oral instructions Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Â The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to hold objects, tools, or equipment. The employee frequently is required to walk, reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance, talk or hear, and taste or smell.

The employee must be able to lift and/or move up to 90 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Spring Lake Village

The Server I is responsible for serving residents and guests in the main dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and in the personal care dining room. Serves residents in private parties, setting up and serving catered parties, cleaning up the dining room, and any other meal service rooms as needed. Assigns proper charges to residents for guest meals, wine served, or any other miscellaneous charges not included in the monthly fees. It is required that this position be in full compliance with HIPAA.

Responsibilities:

  • Serves food and beverages to residents and guests in the dining room, in the personal care dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and other areas where food is served.
  • Provides professional and courteous service using correct service techniques.
  • Takes resident and guest food orders and carries food to table using waiter trays.
  • Sets up and serves catered parties and coffee breaks as assigned. Breaks down and cleans up after catered parties.
  • Serves residents and their guests in the Dining Room, and is responsible for properly charging each account for food and beverages served.
  • Sets up, serves and takes down all breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets.
  • Considers placement of foods to create an attractive display that is convenient for residents.
  • Maintains the cleanliness of the areas, and assures dish ware and/or utensils are supplied as needed.
  • Performs side duties as assigned, including preparing the dining room for service and maintaining the cleanliness of the dining room, the wait stations, tea room, and private rooms after catered events, and related kitchen areas.
  • Attends and participates in menu meetings and monthly in-service meetings as scheduled.
  • Employee must be able to work well under pressure; meeting multiple and sometimes competing deadlines. Employee must at all times demonstrate cooperative behavior with staff, colleagues, and supervisors.
  • Assists Host/Hostess with opening duties as assigned.
  • Answers phone calls in the dining room in the absence of the Host/Hostess, using proper language as instructed.
  • Takes messages and forwards to the appropriate people.
  • Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; and if an emergency or disaster occurs, immediately assumes the pre-assigned emergency duties.
  • Performs other duties or responsibilities as assigned by the Assistant Director of Dining Services, Executive Chef and the Director of Dinning Services.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • English proficiency.
  • Experience or aptitude for working with senior citizens preferred.
  • Must be customer-oriented and possess good communication skills.
  • Able to follow both written and verbal instructions and relate to older people.
  • Able to manage several tasks at one time efficiently and temperately.
  • Able to form cooperative, effective, productive working relationships.
  • Able to learn new tasks as the department grows and develops.

If you're looking for a career that provides more than competitive salaries and wages, and more than great benefits, then consider an opportunity with Vista del Monte. You'll work for a company that recognizes it cannot meet its customers' needs without first meeting the needs of its employees.

Under the supervision of the Dining Room Manager, a Server, interacts with our residents and employees of Front Porch residential facilities, and ensures they have a great experience when dining. Servers are expected to have some basic food knowledge by performing the following duties.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Â· Prepares the tables, laying out napkins and utensils, making sure the condiments are refilled, performing all other preparation tasks.

Â· Staying updated on current menu choices, specialties and menu deviations, knowing if the kitchen staff is running out of any items.

Â· Direct guests to their tables, presenting menus, suggesting dishes, assisting in drink selection, informing guests about food preparation details, communicating specific guest needs to the cooks.

Â· Maintaining proper dining experience, delivering items, fulfilling guest needs, offering desserts and drinks, removing courses, replenishing utensils, refilling glasses.

Â· Performing basic cleaning tasks as needed or directed by supervisor.

BENEFITS INCLUDE:
- competitive wages,
- amazing health benefits (medical, dental & vision for 32+ hrs per week)
- employer paid life insurance,
- a great retirement program,
- holiday pay,
- paid time off (or sick time),
- free employee meals,
- monthly team meetings and celebrations,
- use of the fitness facilities.

If you would like to join our team, we want to meet you! Please apply online, by attaching your resume to this application or in person at the Vista Del Monte Administration Office at 3775 Modoc Road, Santa Barbara, CA 93105. The office is open Monday through Sunday from 8:30 am - 5 pm.

***If you have ever been charged with a misdemeanor or felony (regardless of how long ago it was), you must already have an approved Livescan Exemption in order to be considered for the position.

ALL APPLICANTS MUST SUBMIT A RESUME ONLINE, OR APPLY IN PERSON TO BE CONSIDERED.

Final candidates must successfully complete a pre-employment physical, drug screen, COVID test and criminal background clearance.

Webster House

JOB SUMMARY

Under the direction of the Charge Nurse, and/or Director of Health Services, the Medical Technician is responsible for performing routine patient/resident care and med pass according to policies and procedures and within acceptable nursing standards.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.


ï‚· Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.Â 

ï‚· Communicates with the residentâ€™s health care providers, supervisor, family members/significant others, and the resident regarding health conditions and both prescription and non-prescription medication needs.

ï‚· Ensures that the available medications coincide with what the authorized prescriber (e.g. physician) has prescribed.Â 

ï‚· Knows the basic rules and precautions of medication assistance. Manages medications and assists the resident to self-administer medications.

ï‚· Follows infection control techniques in performing patient/resident care.Â 

ï‚· Understands the guidelines for the proper storage, security and documentation of centrally stored medications.Â 

ï‚· Follows the process used for medication ordering, refills and the receipt of medications from the pharmacy.Â 

ï‚· Logs all medications on community-approved medication log when received.Â 

ï‚· Destroys medications as needed and in accordance with state and community procedures.Â 

ï‚· Documents all communication with prescribers, family/significant others, and the resident according to your community policy.Â 

ï‚· Continual observation of each resident for potential adverse reactions to medications and/or signs/symptoms indicating the need for a change to the medication regime.Â 

ï‚· May assist community with caregiver functions.Â 

ï‚· Maintains all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations and Company policy.Â 

ï‚· Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of medication.

ï‚· Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.Â 

ï‚· Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.


JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


ï‚· For unlicensed staff that assist with the self-administration of medications, a total of twenty four (24) hours of training shall be provided within the first four weeks of employment. Sixteen (16) hours of hands-on shadowing and eight (8) hours of instruction shall be completed prior to assisting with the self-administration of medications. Four (4) hours of in-service training on medication related issues shall be completed in each succeeding 12 month period.Â 

ï‚· Ability to read, write, speak and understand English.Â 

ï‚· Basic mathematical skills required.

Â ï‚· Able to understand, follow, support and initiate policies and procedures of the facility. Must be able to recognize emergency situations and respond appropriately.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS and WORK ENVIRONMENT

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


ï‚· Regularly required to stand, walk, talk or hear, grasp, push, pull and smell.Â 

ï‚· Frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms.Â 

ï‚· Occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.Â 

ï‚· Must be able to wear gloves to guard against exposure to body fluids and cleaning agents.Â 

ï‚· Must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, over 25 pounds will require mechanical assistance or the aid of a co-worker.Â 

ï‚· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Â 

ï‚· Frequently exposed to wet and/or humid conditions.Â 

ï‚· Potential to exposure of body fluids and cleaning agents and contact with needles or other sharp objects.Â 

ï‚· Noise level is usually moderate

Summary:

The Maintenance Technician I helps ensure the effective overall maintenance, operation and safety of the facility, including, but not limited to, plumbing, electrical, painting, minor carpentry and equipment repairs.

Responsibilities:

Â·Uses basic hand and power tools, such as hammers, saws, screwdrivers, wrenches, saber saws and hand drills and basic electrical inspection and electrical test equipment and tools.

Â·Assists in performing minor electrical repairs to building electrical systems.

Â·Paints interior and exterior walls, doors, ceilings, beams, carport areas, fences, etc.; refinishes furniture as required.

Â·Repairs, moves, assembles, installs and sets up heavy equipment and furniture, picture frames, etc.

Â·Assists with general plumbing repairs to building systems.

Â·Assists in performing minor carpentry work.

Â·Assists in maintenance and repair of all facility equipment, includes laundry, food service and nursing equipment.

Â·Assists with routine maintenance of facility equipment; maintains log books as required.

Â·Observes conditions of facility and reports any problems noted to Management.

Â·At all times demonstrates cooperative behavior with staff, colleagues and supervisors.

  • Participates in training as assigned.

Â·Performs other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Â·Possesses mechanical aptitude; able to learn and retain basic skills of the trade.

Â·Able to work well under pressure, meeting multiple and sometimes competing deadlines.

  • Able to establish effective working relationships with others throughout the facility.

Â· Able to learn to read diagrams, and operating and maintenance instructions.

Education and Qualifications:

Â·High School diploma or equivalent required.

Â· Trade or vocational school training preferred.

Â·Must complete and pass a physical examination with tuberculosis (TB) screen prior to employment.

Â·Employment contingent upon fingerprint clearance from the Department of Justice.

Work Environment, Physical and Mental Capabilities, and Other Requirements:

Â·While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to perform strenuous labor for extended periods of time and to stand, walk and sit intermittently; to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and to hear and speak with peers, residents, and others. The employee is often required to move continually throughout the work day; to work in all kinds of weather conditions. The employee is regularly required to maintain dexterity to pinch small objects; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, climb, crawl, and work in awkward or cramped positions or on ladders. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 35 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Summary

After-Hours Live-In Response Staff are responsible for the safety and securityÂ  Â in Compton, CA. TheÂ After-Hours Live-In Response Staff will respond to emergency situations in an appropriate and timely manner to help provide efficient operations consistent with established standards and practices.

Seeking a mature and reliable person who are available to work 5 days a week, ending Saturday morning at 7:00 am and live on-site during their shift. Usual workday does not exceed more than three actual hours of work.

Working from Monday 4:30 pm till 8:00 am for the following day thru Saturday morning at 8:00 am
Work Schedule:
During the week, hours are 4:30pm to 8:00 AM. On-call for entire holidays.Â Must be able to work some holidays, as scheduled.

1- bedroom unfurnished apartment on the 2ndfloor. Stove and refrigerator included. No dishwasher or washer/dryer in unit; laundry room is in the building. Utilities are not included. Pets must adhere to the Pet Policy. Apartment is provided with an apartment creditÂ applied towards minimum wage.Â Hourly rate of $16.20 will be calculated on weekly timecards and used toward the value of the rental credit. Any balance of compensation will be paid on a bi-weekly basis.

Responsibilities

  • Respond to resident routine and emergency calls/situations and general assistance to elderly residents,Â and seek appropriate help as necessary
  • May have to call 911 as needed
  • Respond to building emergencies and seek appropriate help
  • Contacts maintenance and/or emergency vendors for repairs after-hours.
  • Respond to maintenance issues and seek appropriate help
  • Complete reports and forms and submit in a timely manner
  • Contact repair companies, as needed and approved by the Housing Administrator
  • Determine appropriateness of emergency call and address per policy and good judgment
  • Perform minor maintenance duties (Change smoke detector battery, plunge toilet, etc.)
  • Perform minor housekeeping duties such as picking up litter from around community, emptying trash cans, cleaning up spills, etc.
  • Secure community and common rooms/areas after regular business hours, on the weekend and/or on holidays
  • Monitor the exterior doors of the community and parking lot daily, on the weekends and/or holidays as needed
  • Be familiar with emergency shut off valves
  • Be familiar with emergency supplies and fire extinguishers
  • Be familiar with entire community and office, maintenance, and electric rooms
  • Attend meetings as scheduled and requested
  • Maintain resident, staff, and office confidentiality
  • Other duties as needed

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Comfortable working at night and in emergency situations
  • Home and/or building maintenance experience
  • Communicate effectively with staff and residents (English, Mandarin, Russian is a plus)
  • Pay close attention to detail

Education and Qualifications

  • High School Graduate
  • Prior on-site living emergency response experience
  • Pass Live Scan background check (FBI & DOJ)
  • Pass work-readiness physical and TB test
  • Working and living with senior residents is a plus

Casa de MaÃ±ana Retirement Community is all about heart. We love people who care, and we care for the people you love. Come see why the vibe at our community is unlike any place youâ€™ve ever worked at.

What separates us from working at another company? Every customer is a regular. Get to know their stories and share their wisdom. Weâ€™re sure you have great plans for your future, and this is the perfect place to build up your skills in customer service, listening, communicating, and leading with care.

A caring and dedicated individual thatâ€™ll be responsible for providing high-quality caregiving services to our residents, making sure they're safe and satisfied. WHO YOU ARE
You have a positive mindset and possess a knack for making other people smile. Youâ€™re adaptable, open to change, and inspire creativity in others. You value human connections and take extra steps to build trust with people. You believe that everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect, and display good patience for those who need more encouragement.

WHAT THE ENVIRONMENT IS LIKE
You will see the Pacific Ocean every day you drive into work. You can have lunch on a bench close to the beach. You may receive warm greetings from residents and co-workers on a daily basis. Your managers care about your success, and it is easy to get recognized for the good work you do.

Job Summary:

Under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer, this position is responsible for leading the effort on current dining facility redesign and future dining facility design, vendor relationships and construction support for Community dining facilities. Additionally, this position will effectively plan, and project manage, from inception to completion, various organizational projects utilizing an entrepreneurial mindset in order to drive positive change consistent with the organizationâ€™s mission and values. Additionally, this position will provide senior leadership in all future acquisition plans of the organization.


Essential Job Functions of Job Description:

1. Recommend redesign, as necessary, to current kitchen layouts design and equipment specifications to enhance efficiency as well as oversee the dining facility design for new construction.

2. Develop and maintain Community food tracking systems and processes as well as develop proficient forecasting and food preparation production that ensures all product is delivered on time and at proper temperatures in each Community.

3. Manage food and supply purchasing vendors to ensure the best quality at the lowest cost - adhering to required product specifications.

4. Develop and implement job flows for all kitchen and production staff.

5. Plan, coordinate and deliver results through complex project management activities using effective project-based communications, workstream identification, prioritization, planning, and execution.

6. Develop full-scale cross-functional project plans.

7. Manages larger business processes and/or projects, setting priorities and measurable objectives, monitoring and reporting on the process, progress and results.

8. Responds to, solves and makes decisions on business requests that have broader department impact and/or moderate risk.

9. Presents alternative solutions to business issues by leveraging the broader organization.

10. Manage project budget and track project deliverables using appropriate project management tools.

11. Organize, display, and communicate contextual information and insights from data in a highly approachable way to enable decision support and actionable next steps.

12. Work closely with account members on project basis as needed â€“ lead communication, and act as key point of contact for meetings, feedback, production needs and logistics.

13. Perform all other related duties as assigned.

Physical Requirements:

1. The employee is regularly required to walk, sit, talk, hear and use hands in a normal manner.

2. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

3. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and peripheral vision.

4. Travel to communities is necessary.

Environmental Conditions:

1. Work is in an office environment, climate controlled through central air conditioning.

2. Will have exposure to outside elements when on construction sites or attending meetings external to home office site.

Education and Experience:

1. College degree in a business discipline or equivalent work experience coupled with a minimum of 10 years of progressive experience managing projects in hospitality or other related industries and a minimum of 5 years of relevant culinary design and management experience in a hospitality management setting or similar experience required.

2. Substantial experience, with a proven track record of success in food and beverage development and operations also required.

3. Experience in coordinating, negotiating, and working with outside vendors in support of timelines and deliverables and in project planning, assessing risk, creating a budget, communicate with the stakeholders, and troubleshoot problems also required.

4. Six Sigma or similar training highly desirable.

JobPostingExport.Description: Program Manager - Home Match - San Francisco
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
San Francisco, Turk Street Office

A new openingsÂ for this San Francisco team! Apply today and tell us what inspires you!

English only - fluent language skills

Looking for a fulfilling role working with a collaborative team to help address the Bay Areaâ€™s housing crisis in an innovative way? Home Match San Francisco is seeking 1Â new program managers to join our team of dedicated service providers as we work to prevent homelessness among older adults and the many other people who rely on Home Match to find affordable housing options.Â 

About Home Match

Home Match is Front Porchâ€™s shared housing program. Our program builds community, one home at a time. We facilitate home-sharing relationships that empower aging community members to stay in their chosen homes through increased income and social connection while creating affordable places to live for people of all ages. Home Match connects homeowners or master tenants who have extra rooms in their home with individuals looking for an affordable living option. Our team supports program participants every step of the way with compassion and creativity, offering tools to ensure a happy, safe, and affordable home for the lifetime of their match.

About the job

The program manager is the primary point of contact for participants, conducting intakes, home visits, processing applications, making introductions between potential homemates, facilitating living-together agreements, and providing ongoing match support. This position is also responsible for increasing the visibility of the program in San Francisco to attract a diverse group of program applicants through in-person and online outreach.Â 

The program manager must have strong cultural competency and be skilled working with people of diverse backgrounds, ages, and circumstances. This position requires flexibility in hours including occasional evening and weekend work. Our work is primarily in-person, either in the field across San Francisco or in our office at Turk Street and Gough Street near BART, major bus lines, fantastic cafes and restaurants, and beautiful Jefferson Square Park. Studies have suggested that women, BIPOC, and LGBTQI+ people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every one of the qualifications in the job description. If this role speaks to you, we encourage you to apply even if you donâ€™t believe you tick all the boxes.

Details and Responsibilities
I. Client Support: ~75%Â 

  • Manage a portfolio of program participants, providing high-touch support during the application process
  • Process applications for new home seekers and home providers, including extensive database use, document collection and running background checks
  • Conduct intake interviews to evaluate the compatibility of home seekers and home providers while also triaging their needs with sensitivity and a sense of urgency
  • Offer warm-handoff referrals to other services that support housing stability
  • Assess the safety and suitability of potential site offerings via home visits and facilitate room readiness
  • Support participants throughout the matching process by making introductions based on shared communication styles and lifestyle preferences, facilitating living together agreements and providing ongoing match support.Â 

II. Community organizing and outreach: ~25%Â 

  • Implement outreach campaigns and track results to recruit sufficient participants to meet program goals
  • Table at community events to share program information and recruit participants
  • Deliver flyers to partner organizations and post flyers in high traffic areas across San Francisco

Â About you

The successful teammate will:

  • Be self-motivated, curious, devoted to social justice, goal-oriented, and compassionate
  • Thrive equally when working independently, within a team, and alongside community partners
  • Relish public speaking opportunities and possess strong verbal and written skills
  • Excel in forming and maintaining relationships with individuals and community-based organizations
  • Be comfortable using digital tools such as Microsoft suite, databases, and Constant Contact
  • Possess excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Take joy in the work and bring a growth mindset to all they do.

Qualifications
The successful candidate will have many but not necessarily all of the following qualifications:

  • 2+ years of relevant experience
  • Either A.A. or B.A. in a relevant field including social work, political science, sociology, education, or psychology OR 4+ years of relevant work experience
  • Experience in social services, case management, education, customer service, community outreach, housing justice organizing, real estate, or program coordination
  • Established network of contacts in San Francisco neighborhoods including community-based organizations, schools, or community leaders and/or government officials
  • Fluent in EnglishÂ 
  • CA driverâ€™s license or ability to get one in the first 2 months of employment

JOB SUMMARY: Keeps the facility in clean and orderly condition by performing the following duties. Additionally assists with maintenance tasks as assigned.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES including the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

Assists the maintenance workers with work orders as requested or assigned by supervisor; including light maintenance functions included in the renovation of resident living units.

Sweeps, mops, scrubs and vacuums hallways, stairs, common areas, empty units, elevators and office space, etc...

Waxes and buffs floors / shampoos carpet

Cleans laundry room(s) and public restroom(s)

Empties trash and garbage containers and sanitizes garbage rooms and shoots

Notifies management concerning need for repairs or replacements of lighting, heating and ventilating equipment.

Walks grounds and pick up debris and litter. Empties ashtrays, sweeps/blows sidewalks, and assists in the maintenance of the landscape and grounds.

Assists with scheduled inspections of apartments required by regulatory agencies.

Assists with the scheduling of the preventative cleaning schedule

Assist with special events by setting up tables and chairs, moving equipment and boxes, etc.

Assists the maintenance workers with work orders as requested or assigned by supervisor; including light maintenance functions included in the renovation of units.

QUALIFICATION REQUIRMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may e made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: High school education preferred but not required; or up to six months related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

LANGUAGE SKILLS; Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS; Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers common fractions and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

REASONING ABILITY: Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out detailed buy uninvolved written or oral instructions Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to hold objects, tools, or equipment. The employee frequently is required to walk, reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance, talk or hear, and taste or smell.

The employee must be able to lift and/or move up to 90 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Claremont Manor Retirement Community is recruiting for a full time Hostess.

Under the supervision of the Dining Room Manager, a Host/Hostess II, assists with the Dining Room operation as assigned or required. Coordinates activities of dining room personnel to provide fast and courteous service to residents and guest by performing the following duties.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Includes the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

Â Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.

Welcome and warmly greet guests on arrival.

Make sure all menus are wiped down, free of spots or stains, and complete.

Make sure entry doors are clean, free of debris and inviting.

Check phone reservations or answering machine messages to assure you have any and/or all reservations.

Check with manager to assure there are no large or private parties you do not know about.

Check with kitchen to see where they stand. See if they are behind or if they are out of anything.

Plan out the seating chart and organize the reservations.

Greets guests, escorts them to their table, pull seat out for the ladies, and present menus.

Make sure the server is aware they have been sat.

Keep in constant contact with the servers and the kitchen to make sure you are not putting them in the weeds. A large part of the dining room effectiveness is orchestrated from the host stand.

Keep an eye out that the dining room, entryway and menus are kept clean throughout operations.

Say good-bye to all of the guests. Check to see that everything was wonderful. Not only is the host or hostess the first impression the guest gets when they come to an establishment they are also the last. You should check with every guest and if there was any kind of problem quickly get a manager.

Perform other duties as assigned by the manager on duty.

Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.

Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.

Follow department safety standards, practice correct body mechanic techniques and participate in campus-wide safety programs.

Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.

Understand facilityâ€™s fire and disaster plans; follow established procedures during drills and actual emergencies.

Oversee and supervise Dining Room in the absence of Dining Room Supervisor, Assistant Supervisor or other designated supervisory personnel.

JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum of 6 months related experience or training.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package and paid-time off.

JOB SUMMARY

Servers are responsible for positive guest interactions while serving in a friendly and efficient manner. At all times, servers are expected to be attentive to our guests needs and making them feel welcome, comfortable, important and relaxed. Servers are expected to have some basic food knowledge by performing the following duties.

Walnut Creek Office

The Front Porch Center for Innovation and Wellbeing (FPCIW;Â www.fpciw.org) explores the innovative uses of technology to empower individuals to thrive, particularly as we age. FPCIW works collaboratively with all stakeholders and in partnership with community members/residents, funding sources, researchers, and technology partners. This Field Project Coordinator (FPC) will primarily support and implement activities for the Center at our northern California Bay Area communities.Â This is a full time hourly position that will start immediately.

The FPC will report to and work closely with the FPCIW vice president to oversee pilot and grant initiatives. This position oversees project development and management, training activities, and volunteer management with an emphasis on direct community engagement and involvement. The FPC also coordinates equipment and technology implementation, supports on-site training associated with this equipment, and serves as a community-resource or a â€œsuper userâ€ of technology-enabled health and wellness applications.

The candidate must be highly independent, demonstrate the capacity to work with little supervision in a fast-paced environment. The candidate will be based out of our Walnut Creek office, and also be able to work comfortably under mobile and telecommuting conditions from home and communities on site.

A valid California Driverâ€™s License, access to an insured vehicle, and ability to frequently travel to and from local community sites participating in projects are required. The position requires an average of 30-60% local travel, and may also include some air travel and overnight stays.

Essential duties and responsibilities:

  • Independently organize training opportunities for various community stakeholders.
  • Develop curriculum and lesson plans relevant to project activities.
  • Support the coordination of equipment installation at community project locations, including on-site training, purchasing, and equipment deployment; serve as a resource for â€œad hocâ€ training necessary throughout the project.
  • Develop and execute project plans that include:

    1. Research and project justification
    2. The design and implementation of outreach strategies to recruit community participants (including staff members);
    3. Training and adoption; and
    4. Project evaluation

    • Ensure the achievement and success of project milestones.
    • Recruit and manage volunteers to support project activities.
    • Develop and oversee data collection and analysis for project evaluation.
    • Produce progress reports, presentations, or other materials, and ensure they are promptly submitted.
    • Maintain appropriate relations with vendors to ensure adherence to project plans.
    • Provide facilitation and other community engagement activities to support the transition within the communities to technology-enabled health and wellness.
    • Provide a leadership or supportive role in the design and implementation of team-based activities, projects and events.
    • Support other team member projects on an as-needed basis.
    • Promote positive and fun working relationships with fellow team members, community collaborators, and business partners.

    Qualifications:

    • Bachelorâ€™s degree; Masters or post-college degree desirable.
    • Prior experience working in a community collaborative or related project.
    • 2+ years of project coordination and management experience.
    • Excellent interpersonal and oral communication skills; ability to verbally express ideas assertively, clearly.
    • Ability to teach technology to community members and colleagues with diverse backgrounds and technology proficiencies.
    • Project management and leadership skills necessary to design, implement and monitor complex, multiple and multi- dimensional projects with a high attention to detail.
    • Excellent written communication skills required to prepare reports, project plans, and presentations.
    • Ability to develop strategic direction and parcel objectives into short-term tasks.
    • Excellent organizational skills and ability to work effectively and independently under pressure with minimal direction.
    • Ability to exercise tact and diplomacy in dealing with others to secure necessary information and cooperation from a variety of stakeholders.
    • Well-rounded technology skills in using desktop computers, laptops, the Internet, and mobile devices with a strong interest in understanding and using technology to support health, wellness, and engagement.
